summary: A detailed explanation of the Four Probe Method experiment to study the variation of resistivity of a germanium crystal with temperature and determine the energy band gap 'Eg'.

events_list.audio_caption: A male speaker describes an experiment and a resulting graph. He explains that he used least-square curve fitting to obtain a linear fit for the graph, resulting in a slope of "1.955". He mentions substituting the slope value into an equation and calculating an energy band gap of "0.77 electron volts". Comparing this to the actual band gap of a germanium crystal, he notes an error of approximately 15% in his results.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a slide titled "Four-probe Method" in orange text, presenting results of an experiment.
